zone.line: It was past two o’clock when
by a sudden turn I found myself close
to a ^the lake near a littl cove where
a little skiff was moored – It was
not far from our house and I
saw my father and Aunt walk
walking on the lawn. I jumped into
the boat, and well accustomed to such
feats, I pushed it it from shore,
and exerted all my strength to row
swiftly across. As I came, dressed
in White, covered only by my tartan
rachan, my hair streaming on
my shoulders, and shooting across with
greater speed than it could be supposed
I could give to my boat, my father
has often told me that I looked
more like a spirit than a human
maid. I approached the shore, my
father held the boat, I leapt lightly
out, and in a moment was in his
